name: Midship
headline: Extract, search and analyze data in your documents
description: We extract and organize structured data from documents, such as PDFs, excel sheets for non-engineers. A CRE firm uses us to pull data from several deals to populate their underwriting spreadsheets in 5 minutes, instead of hours.

founders.name: Kieran Taylor, Co-Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder of Midship - Extract, search and analyze data in your documents.

Spent 7 years building data platforms at Instacart, Amazon & Deloitte. Experienced every pain point possible working with data-focused teams.

From the UK, avid traveller, mediocre tennis player, competitive vimmer.

founders.name: Aahel Iyer, Founder
founders.description: Former indie rock guitarist turned product designer. Shaped user experiences at Lyft, Faire, and Dashworks, specializing in financial products, and gen AI. Moved from India to the US at 18. Now using diverse insights to build user centric products.

founders.name: Max Maio, Co-Founder
founders.description: Shipped software loaning billions at PayPal; built an AI-powered app from zero to one at Dashworks. Snowboarder, surfer, and espresso machine fixer.

# The AI augmented auditor is here
# The AI augmented auditor is here
# The AI augmented auditor is here
We're witnessing an unprecedented transformation in audit.
Midship creates superhuman auditors by augmenting them with AI at every step of an engagement.
The days of trawling through PBC data dumps, manually ticking and tying thousands of samples, and rebuilding the same work papers year after year will soon feel like using a paper map in the age of GPS.
Midship is designed to put the human auditor first. Every decision taken by AI is traceable back to the evidence you already rely on during a procedure. Nothing makes it to the client without a human auditor verifying that work. 
Free your auditors to think critically and let Midship do the rest.
We're witnessing an unprecedented transformation in audit.
Midship creates superhuman auditors by augmenting them with AI at every step of an engagement.
The days of trawling through PBC data dumps, manually ticking and tying thousands of samples, and rebuilding the same work papers year after year will soon feel like using a paper map in the age of GPS.
Midship is designed to put the human auditor first. Every decision taken by AI is traceable back to the evidence you already rely on during a procedure. Nothing makes it to the client without a human auditor verifying that work. 
Free your auditors to think critically and let Midship do the rest.
## By 2026, we'll reduce audit times by 50%.
## By 2026, we'll reduce audit times by 50%.

# Our Roadmap
# Our Roadmap
Test of Details
Find relevant documents and check for completeness, existence, obligations and more
PBC Processes
Track what you've received and automate client communications to get what's missing
Analytical Procedures
Uncover hidden trends and anomalies through powerful ratio analysis and trend comparisons
Risk Mapping
Identify critical risks and control gaps, so you know exactly what deserves your attention
Completeness
Confidently sign off and ensure your audit stands up to partner review

generated_description:
Midship is a fresh player in the tech scene, founded in 2024 and hailing from the bustling tech hub of San Francisco. It's part of Y Combinator’s Batch S24, which isn’t just a badge of honor; it’s a seal of validation that this startup is onto something valuable.

The mission here is straightforward: Midship aims to extract, search, and analyze data within documents, mainly targeting the often cumbersome process of handling financial audits. Think about it. Traditionally, extracting relevant data from piles of PDFs and Excel documents would eat up hours of an auditor's time. Midship is flipping that script. In just five minutes, they can pull critical data, allowing auditors to focus on the insights rather than the grunt work. 

Their technology acts as an AI-augmented assistant, turning the laborious audit process into something far more efficient—a sort of GPS for auditors navigating through data. It organizes and structures documents, runs key audit tests, and automatically generates ready-to-submit Excel work papers, all while ensuring every AI decision is traceable back to relevant evidence. Plus, human oversight remains a core part of their process, ensuring that nothing gets rubber-stamped without thorough review.

With a lean team of three and a dedicated Group Partner in Diana Hu, Midship is positioned to make a significant impact on how audit firms work, promising to cut traditional audit times by 50% by 2026. And did I mention they’re offering a demo? If you're curious about leveraging AI to optimize audit workflows, there’s a clear pathway to see it in action.

Visit [Midship's website](https://midship.ai/) to explore their offerings, secure a demo, or dive deeper into their plans for revolutionizing the auditing landscape. It might just be the audit assistant you didn’t know you needed.
